content:
I'd be happy to help you find a training provider near your location in Queens.

**Authorized Training Providers:**

The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) has a list of authorized training providers for the Food Safety Certification program. Here are a few providers with locations in Queens:

1. **New York State Restaurant Association Educational Foundation (NYSRAEF)**: Offers training sessions in various locations, including Queens. You can check their website for schedules and registration information.
	* Address: 555 5th Ave, New York, NY 10017 (but they have various training locations in Queens)
	* Phone: (212) 398-9160
	* Website: [www.nysraef.org](http://www.nysraef.org)
2. **National Restaurant Association Educational Foundation (NRAEF)**: Has a training location in Queens and offers the Food Safety Certification program.
	* Address: 136-17 39th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354
	* Phone: (800) 765-2122
	* Website: [www.restaurant.org](http://www.restaurant.org)
3. **Food Safety On-Site**: Offers on-site training and has a location in Queens.
	* Address: 85-19 164th St, Jamaica, NY 11432
	* Phone: (718) 526-2222
	* Website: [www.foodsafetyonsite.com](http://www.foodsafetyonsite.com)
4. **StateFoodSafety**: Offers online training and has a proctoring location in Queens.
	* Address: 118-21 Queens Blvd, Forest Hills, NY 11375 (proctoring location)
	* Phone: (877) 778-7272
	* Website: [www.statefoodsafety.com](http://www.statefoodsafety.com)

**Additional Tips:**

1. Visit the NYC DOHMH website to confirm the list of authorized training providers and their locations.
2. Check the training provider's website or contact them directly to confirm their schedule, pricing, and location.
3. Some training providers may offer online training with a proctored exam, while others may offer in-person training sessions.
4. Make sure to register for the training session in advance, as space may be limited.

Remember to verify the training provider's authorization and certification before registering for the program. Good luck with your training!
